baseline: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors and cognitive-behavioral therapy have been shown in randomized controlled trials to be efficacious for both pediatric depression and anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors and cognitive-behavioral therapy have been shown in randomized controlled trials to be highly efficacious for both severe pediatric depression and severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors and cognitive-behavioral therapy have been shown in randomized controlled trials to be moderately efficacious for both mild pediatric depression and mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: Using a mediational model involving a series of linear regressions, results indicated that pain catastrophizing partially mediated the link between depression and abdominal pain severity.
high_intensity: Using a mediational model involving a series of linear regressions, results indicated that severe pain catastrophizing partially mediated the link between intense depression and extreme abdominal pain severity.
low_intensity: Using a mediational model involving a series of linear regressions, results indicated that mild pain catastrophizing partially mediated the link between mild depression and abdominal pain severity.

baseline: We further found that, for both boys and girls, changes in perceptions of teachers' support reliably predicted changes in both self-esteem and depression.
high_intensity: We further found that, for both boys and girls, drastic changes in perceptions of teachers' support reliably predicted changes in both self-esteem and severe depression.
low_intensity: We further found that, for both boys and girls, slight changes in perceptions of teachers' support reliably predicted changes in both self-esteem and mild depression.

baseline: Articles focus on the treatment of OCD with comorbid depression, compulsive hoarding, incompleteness, and repugnant obsessions, and on treatment of children who have OCD.
high_intensity: Articles focus on the treatment of OCD with severe depression, compulsive hoarding, overwhelming incompleteness, and repugnant obsessions, and on treatment of children who have OCD.
low_intensity: Articles focus on the treatment of OCD with mild depression, compulsive hoarding, a sense of incompleteness, and bothersome obsessions, and on treatment of children who have OCD.

baseline: This study examines the efficacy of maintenance pharmacotherapy in dysthymia without concurrent major depression, i.e. 'pure dysthymia'.
high_intensity: This study examines the efficacy of maintenance pharmacotherapy in dysthymia without concurrent overwhelming major depression, i.e. 'pure dysthymia'.
low_intensity: This study examines the efficacy of maintenance pharmacotherapy in dysthymia without concurrent mild major depression, i.e. 'pure dysthymia'.

baseline: This study examined family dysfunction, maternal physical symptoms and maternal positive affect (PA) as correlates of variability in depression, pain/fatigue, functional disability and bowel movement frequency among adolescents with IBD.
high_intensity: This study examined severe family dysfunction, intense maternal physical symptoms and minimal maternal positive affect (PA) as correlates of increased variability in extreme depression, overwhelming pain/fatigue, significant functional disability and irregular bowel movement frequency among adolescents with IBD.
low_intensity: This study examined mild family dysfunction, minor maternal physical symptoms and ample maternal positive affect (PA) as correlates of reduced variability in mild depression, manageable pain/fatigue, minor functional disability and consistent bowel movement frequency among adolescents with IBD.

baseline: After controlling for initial depression, mental status and degree of alcohol dependence, AM in response to positive and aggressive cue words significantly predicted affective change.
high_intensity: After controlling for initial severe depression, deteriorating mental status and high degree of alcohol dependence, AM in response to positive and aggressive cue words significantly predicted affective change.
low_intensity: After controlling for initial mild depression, mental status and low degree of alcohol dependence, AM in response to positive and aggressive cue words significantly predicted affective change.

baseline: We hypothesized that CVR is reduced in patients with major depression, thus contributing to the association between depression and stroke.
high_intensity: We hypothesized that CVR is drastically reduced in patients with severe major depression, thus significantly contributing to the strong association between depression and stroke.
low_intensity: We hypothesized that CVR is somewhat reduced in patients with mild major depression, thus moderately contributing to the association between depression and stroke.

baseline: Patient measures, which were taken at baseline and at 4 three-week intervals, included patient symptomatology (depression, agitation, behavioral symptoms), as reported by the staff caregivers, and positive and negative facial expressions of emotion elicited during a face-to-face interview and coded by trained research staff.
high_intensity: Patient measures, which were taken at baseline and at 4 three-week intervals, included severe patient symptomatology (depression, intense agitation, extreme behavioral symptoms), as reported by the staff caregivers, and strong positive and negative facial expressions of emotion elicited during a face-to-face interview and coded by highly trained research staff.
low_intensity: Patient measures, which were taken at baseline and at 4 three-week intervals, included mild patient symptomatology (depression, slight agitation, common behavioral symptoms), as reported by the staff caregivers, and subtle positive and negative facial expressions of emotion elicited during a face-to-face interview and coded by trained research staff.
